content:
The reference of Legislation under the heading "Avoidance of Certain Terms and Right of Recovery" is limited to Sections 7, 8 and 9 of the Motor Vehicles (Third Party Risks & Compensation) Act (Republic of Singapore) and Sections 94, 95, 96 of the Road Transport Act 1987 (Malaysia).

#### 2. Jurisdiction
The indemnity under this Policy shall not apply in respect of judgments which are not in the first instance delivered by or obtained from a Court of competent jurisdiction within West Malaysia or the Republic of Singapore.
questions: What sections of the Motor Vehicles Act are referenced under 'Avoidance of Certain Terms and Right of Recovery'?
Which act does Sections 94, 95, and 96 belong to?
In which countries does the Motor Vehicles (Third Party Risks & Compensation) Act apply?
What does the indemnity under the policy not cover in terms of jurisdiction?
Can you list the sections of the Road Transport Act 1987 mentioned in the text?
Where must the court judgments originate from for the indemnity to apply under this policy?
What are the limitations of the indemnity regarding the jurisdiction in the policy?
Does the indemnity apply to judgments delivered outside of West Malaysia or Singapore?
What specific parts of the legislation are referred to in the avoidance clause?
In which two countries does the policy specify the competent jurisdiction for indemnity?
